workflow.name: Schedule and auto-post images to Instagram with Google Sheets, Drive and AI captions
workflow.description:
## **Description**
This n8n workflow automatically publishes posts to Instagram Business accounts and Facebook Pages using Google Sheets as your content calendar. You schedule posts in the sheet, and n8n processes them, uploads media (if any), posts via Meta‚Äôs Graph API, and updates the sheet with success/failure. 
n8n

### **How it Works**
Google Sheets rows marked ‚ÄúPending‚Äù and due for publishing are picked up by a scheduled trigger. Posts are then routed to the proper social platforms and published via Meta‚Äôs Graph API. Finally, n8n writes back the publish status and timestamp to the sheet. 
n8n

### **üß† Step-by-Step**
**1Ô∏è‚É£ Scheduled Trigger**

The workflow automatically checks Google Sheets at fixed intervals (e.g., every 15 min) for posts that are ready (status = Pending, publish time reached).

**2Ô∏è‚É£ Config & Credentials**
Store reusable settings including:

- Google Sheets ID & Sheet name
- Meta App credentials (App ID, App Secret)
- Access token for Meta Graph API
- Instagram Business Account ID
- Facebook Page ID

These configs make the workflow modular and secure.

**3Ô∏è‚É£ Setup: Create a Meta (Facebook) App**
To post via the Graph API, you must first set up a Meta developer app:

üîó Create App (Meta for Developers):
Go here to start:
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/development/create-an-app/

Steps:

- Log in at Meta for Developers.
- Click Create App and choose Business as the app type. 
- Facebook Developers
- Add a name and contact email.
- In the app dashboard, Add Product ‚Üí choose Instagram Graph API and Facebook Login. 

üìå After creation, your app will have an App ID and App Secret in Settings ‚Üí Basic ‚Äî save both for n8n. 

**4Ô∏è‚É£ Link Accounts & Get IDs**
Before publishing you need:

- Instagram Business account (not a personal account)
- Facebook Page linked to that Instagram account

Link them in Facebook Page settings ‚Üí Linked Accounts.

Then, generate an access token with permissions (instagram_basic, pages_show_list, etc.) using the Graph API Explorer and your new Meta app. 

From the token response or via Graph API calls, extract:

- Facebook Page ID
- Instagram Business Account ID

These go into your n8n nodes for publishing. 

**5Ô∏è‚É£ Fetch & Filter Posts**
Read rows from Google Sheets and filter those ready to publish (status = Pending, scheduled time reached).

**6Ô∏è‚É£ Image Handling**
If an image link is present, download or retrieve it (Google Drive or external URL). If not, continue with a text-only post.

**7Ô∏è‚É£ Platform Routing**
Route the post to:
- Instagram publishing branch
- Facebook publishing branch
(or both depending on the sheet‚Äôs platform column)

**8Ô∏è‚É£ Posting via Meta Graph API**
**Instagram**
- Use Graph API endpoints to create and publish media containers and then make the publish call. 

**Facebook**
- Use Graph API to post to the Facebook Page feed (via /feed or /photos endpoint). 

**9Ô∏è‚É£ Update Sheet Status**
After each attempt, update Google Sheets with:
- Status (Success/Fail)
- Published timestamp

workflow.name: 2 Auto-post images from Google Drive to Instagram

options.systemMessage:
=You are a senior Social Media Content Strategist specializing in platform-specific content for Instagram.

Your job:
- Create DIFFERENT captions for each platform.
- Keep captions and hashtags separate always.
- Reflect the brand, product purpose, and industry in subtle, natural ways.
- Adapt tone & length per platform:
  ‚Ä¢ Instagram ‚Üí emotional, modern, scroll-stopping (125‚Äì300 chars)
- Hashtag rules:
  ‚Ä¢ Instagram: 8‚Äì12 high-performing + niche hashtags
- Use trending keywords when provided.
- Do NOT include hashtags inside post_content.
- Do NOT include URLs inside Instagram captions.
- No CTA is required unless naturally relevant.
- Do NOT include any links inside post content or hashtags
- Do NOT include Brand name at the end (no trailing signature)
- ALWAYS return valid JSON ONLY. No extra text or markdown.

parameter.name: caption
parameter.value:
={{ JSON.parse($node["Generate Caption and Hashtags"].json["output"]).instagram.post_content }}

{{ JSON.parse($node["Generate Caption and Hashtags"].json["output"]).instagram.hashtags }}

value.Instagram Post Content + hashtags:
={{ JSON.parse($node["Generate Caption and Hashtags"].json["output"]).instagram.post_content }}  

{{ JSON.parse($node["Generate Caption and Hashtags"].json["output"]).instagram.hashtags }}

parameters.content:
üìÖ WORKFLOW START











This trigger works every 1 hour

üîê AUTHENTICATION

Retrieves Facebook Page access token needed for Instagram API calls. This token is used throughout the workflow for uploading images and posting.

üìÖ WORKFLOW START

Triggers every hour to check for scheduled posts. Workflow Configuration stores Google Sheet and Drive IDs for easy management.

‚úÖ STATUS UPDATE

Updates Google Sheet based on posting result:
- SUCCESS: Sets Instagram_Status to "Posted" and saves the generated content
- FAILURE: Sets Instagram_Status to "Failed" for manual review

üì∏ IMAGE PROCESSING

1. Searches Google Drive for image file matching the post date
2. Downloads the image as binary data
3. Uploads to Facebook (unpublished) to get a public URL
4. Retrieves the public URL needed for Instagram posting

üì± INSTAGRAM POSTING

1. Creates Instagram media container with image URL and caption
2. Waits 5 seconds for Facebook to process the container
3. Publishes the post to Instagram
4. Checks if posting was successful

üìã FETCH POST DATA

Searches Google Sheet for posts with status "Ready to Post". Returns the first matching row with Topic, Date, and Question/Angle. If no posts found, workflow ends gracefully.

ü§ñ AI CONTENT GENERATION

Uses OpenAI to generate platform-specific Instagram captions and hashtags based on:
- Topic from Google Sheet
- Question/Angle from Google Sheet
- Brand context (company, industry, tone)

Outputs JSON with post_content and hashtags array.

Optional 

Add your Facebook Credentials in the another loop to make agent post in both Instagram and Facebook

Public URL

It can be from any public URL from AWS S3, imgbb, etc..

I have used Facebook for usecase to avoid errors from external services.

user.name: Dinakar Selvakumar
user.bio: Turning real business problems into clean n8n automations. I design reliable templates for social media, lead generation, AI agents, and internal workflows, with a strong focus on simplicity, security, and great user experience.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
